install.name: Avanti
install.author: Anthony Olsen
install.description: Avanti is a smooth business Joomla template with a creative edge - Its the perfect vehicle to put your business out in front at the start of a new decade.

param.name: @spacer
param.default: The following parameters control the overall look and feel of the template.

param.name: fontStackBody
param.label: Font-Family Body
param.description: Select the font stack to use for the body styling
param.option: Cambria, Georgia, Times, ‘Times New Roman’, serif

param.name: fontStackHeading
param.label: Font-Family Headings
param.description: Select the font stack to use for the headings styling
param.option: Adobe Caslon Pro, Georgia, Garamond, Times, serif

param.name: fontStackNav
param.label: Navigation Font Stack
param.description: Select the font stack to use for the headings styling
param.option: Adobe Caslon Pro, Georgia, Garamond, Times, serif

param.name: fontSize
param.label: Font Size
param.description: This can be a px or % and sets the base size of the fonts on the site.

param.name: @spacer
param.default: To have your logo display in the dropdownlist you need to upload the folder to templates/avanti/style/logo

param.name: logoFile
param.label: Logo image
param.description: Select the image to use for your logo. Your logo should be uploaded to the templates/zengrid/style/logo folder

param.name: logoLink
param.label: Logo hyperlink
param.description: Type the relative or absolute url for the link attached to the logo.

param.name: bgImage
param.label: Background Image
param.description: Select the image to use for the background of the banner row div. Your image should be uploaded to the templates/avanti/style/bg folder

param.name: hilite
param.label: Typographical Hilite
param.description: Select the colour hilite to use on your site for links and typography. Should you want to create your own your css file should be uploaded to the templates/avanti/style/hilite folder

param.name: @spacer
param.default: The following values control the format/layout of the template. This theme uses a complex grid system that is incredibly flexible so please be sure to read all documentation. If you feel a little overwhelmed you can leave the default settings where they are.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
General Width Settings
The following values control the general and overall layout of the template. Set the template width, the number of the columns the page should be divided into and then specify the the width of the gutter in between each column.

param.name: position
param.label: Main Container alignment
param.description: Select the alignment of the main container

param.name: @spacer
param.default: Set the distance from the left or right margin if the above setting is left or right. This can be a px or % width and needs to have px or % after the value.

param.name: containerMargin
param.label: Left or right offset
param.description: Set th eleft or right offset of the main container if the template is positioned to the left or right using the position setting above.

param.name: @spacer
param.default: Set the overall width of the template.

param.name: tWidth
param.label: Template Width
param.description: This setting controls the overall width of the template including the margins.

param.name: @spacer
param.default: Set the number of columns to divide the website container into.

param.name: cols
param.label: Number of Columns
param.description: Select the background image of the template

param.name: @spacer
param.default: Set the width of the buffer between each column.

param.name: gutter
param.label: Gutter Width
param.description: This setting controls the margin between each grid element.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Top Row of Modules
The following values need to add up to the total number of columns specified above. If any of the module positions in this row arent published then the value assigned to them does not count.

param.name: topEqual
param.label: Module widths
param.description: Select whether to equalise the modules published to a specific row. If set to use individual widths then the ratios below will have a bearing on the widths.
param.option: Use individual module position widths below
Equalise width according to number of modules published

param.name: top1Width
param.label: Top1 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: top2Width
param.label: Top2 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: top3Width
param.label: Top3 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: top4Width
param.label: Top4 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Header Row of Modules
The following values need to add up to the total number of columns specified above. If any of the module positions in this row arent published then the value assigned to them does not count. Please note that if you have chosen to display the logo on the same level as the menu then this row contains header1, header2, header3 and header4 module positions, otherwise if you display the logo in this row then there are only modules header2 to header4 available.

param.name: headerEqual
param.label: Module widths
param.description: Select whether to equalise the modules published to a specific row. If set to use individual widths then the ratios below will have a bearing on the widths.
param.option: Use individual module position widths below
Equalise width according to number of modules published

param.name: header1Width
param.label: Header1 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: header2Width
param.label: Header2 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: header3Width
param.label: Header3 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: header4Width
param.label: Header4 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Logo and Navigation Strip
The following values need to add up to the total number of columns specified above. If any of the module positions in this row arent published then the value assigned to them does not count. If the logo is published to the header row then it takes the position of the header1 image.

param.name: logoPosition
param.label: Logo Position
param.description: Set the row for where the logo should be positioned.
param.option: On same row as header module positions
On same row as the nav

param.name: navLeft
param.label: Menu alignment
param.description: Select whether to align the menu to the left or the right. Select the left if you are choosing to hide the logo or display the logo in the header row.

param.name: logoWidth
param.label: Logo Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: navWidth
param.label: Navigation Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Top three rows of the grid
The following three blocks of parameters refer to the top three rows of grid modules.

param.name: grid1Equal
param.label: Module widths
param.description: Select whether to equalise the modules published to a specific row. If set to use individual widths then the ratios below will have a bearing on the widths.
param.option: Use individual module position widths below
Equalise width according to number of modules published

param.name: grid1Width
param.label: Grid1 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid2Width
param.label: Grid2 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid3Width
param.label: Grid3 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid4Width
param.label: Grid4 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid2Equal
param.label: Module widths
param.description: Select whether to equalise the modules published to a specific row. If set to use individual widths then the ratios below will have a bearing on the widths.
param.option: Use individual module position widths below
Equalise width according to number of modules published

param.name: grid5Width
param.label: Grid5 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid6Width
param.label: Grid6 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid7Width
param.label: Grid7 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid8Width
param.label: Grid8 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid3Equal
param.label: Module widths
param.description: Select whether to equalise the modules published to a specific row. If set to use individual widths then the ratios below will have a bearing on the widths.
param.option: Use individual module position widths below
Equalise width according to number of modules published

param.name: grid9Width
param.label: Grid9 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid10Width
param.label: Grid10 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid11Width
param.label: Grid11 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid12Width
param.label: Grid12 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Advert1-3 row of modules
The following three blocks of parameters refer to the top three Advert module positions.

param.name: advert1Width
param.label: Advert1 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: advert2Width
param.label: Advert2 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: advert3Width
param.label: Advert3 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Main Content Area - Center Module
The following parameter control the position of the center module relative to the main content area. This setting is only relevant if the center module is published.

param.name: mainLayout
param.label: Center module position
param.description: Set the width of this module position.
param.option: Center module published before main content
Center module published after main content

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Main Content Widths - Left Column
The following parameters control the layout and widths for the left and main content/component space in the template in left column mode. This mode is triggered when you have at least one module published to the left position and no modules published to the right and center positions.

param.name: leftCols2L
param.label: Left Column Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: midCols2L
param.label: Main Content Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Main Content Widths - Right Column
The following parameters control the layout and widths for the right module and main content/component space in the template in right column mode. This mode is triggered when you have at least one module published to the right position and no modules published to the left and center positions.

param.name: midCols2R
param.label: Main Content Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: rightCols2R
param.label: Right Column Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Main Content Widths - Three Columns
The following parameters control the layout and widths for the left, right and main content/component space in the template in three column mode. This mode is triggered when you have at least one module published to the left and right position and no modules published to the center positions.

param.name: leftCols3LR
param.label: Left Column Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: midCols3LR
param.label: Main Content Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: rightCols3LR
param.label: Right Column Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Main Content Widths - Four Columns (left + center + maincontent + right)
The following parameters control the layout and widths for the left, right and main content/component space in the template in three column mode. This mode is triggered when you have at least one module published to the left, right and center module positions.

param.name: leftCols4LRC
param.label: Left Column Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: midCols4LRC
param.label: Main Content Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: centerCols4LRC
param.label: Center Column Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: rightCols4LRC
param.label: Right Column Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Main Content Widths - Three Columns (left + center + main content)
The following parameters control the layout and widths for the left, right and main content/component space in the template in three column mode. This mode is triggered when you have at least one module published to the left and center position and no modules published to the right positions.

param.name: leftCols3LC
param.label: Left Column Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: centerCols3LC
param.label: Center Column Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: midCols3LC
param.label: Main Content Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Main Content Widths - Three Columns (main content + center + right)
The following parameters control the layout and widths for the left, right and main content/component space in the template in three column mode. This mode is triggered when you have at least one module published to the left and center position and no modules published to the right positions.

param.name: midCols3RC
param.label: Main Content Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: centerCols3RC
param.label: Center Column Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: rightCols3RC
param.label: Right Column Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Advert4-6 row of modules
The following three blocks of parameters refer to the bottom three Advert module positions.

param.name: advert4Width
param.label: Advert4 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: advert5Width
param.label: Advert5 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: advert6Width
param.label: Advert6 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Bottom three rows of the grid
The following three blocks of parameters refer to the bottom three rows of grid modules.

param.name: grid4Equal
param.label: Module widths
param.description: Select whether to equalise the modules published to a specific row. If set to use individual widths then the ratios below will have a bearing on the widths.
param.option: Use individual module position widths below
Equalise width according to number of modules published

param.name: grid13Width
param.label: Grid13 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid14Width
param.label: Grid14 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid15Width
param.label: Grid15 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid16Width
param.label: Grid16 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid5Equal
param.label: Module widths
param.description: Select whether to equalise the modules published to a specific row. If set to use individual widths then the ratios below will have a bearing on the widths.
param.option: Use individual module position widths below
Equalise width according to number of modules published

param.name: grid17Width
param.label: Grid17 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid18Width
param.label: Grid18 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid19Width
param.label: Grid19 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid20Width
param.label: Grid20 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid6Equal
param.label: Module widths
param.description: Select whether to equalise the modules published to a specific row. If set to use individual widths then the ratios below will have a bearing on the widths.
param.option: Use individual module position widths below
Equalise width according to number of modules published

param.name: grid21Width
param.label: Grid21 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid22Width
param.label: Grid22 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid23Width
param.label: Grid23 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: grid24Width
param.label: Grid24 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Bottom Module Positions (Bottom1 to bottom4)
The following values need to add up to the total number of columns specified above. If any of the module positions in this row arent published then the value assigned to them does not count.

param.name: bottomEqual
param.label: Module widths
param.description: Select whether to equalise the modules published to a specific row. If set to use individual widths then the ratios below will have a bearing on the widths.
param.option: Use individual module position widths below
Equalise width according to number of modules published

param.name: bottom1Width
param.label: Bottom1 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: bottom2Width
param.label: Bottom2 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: bottom3Width
param.label: Bottom3 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: bottom4Width
param.label: Bottom4 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: bottom5Width
param.label: Bottom5 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: @spacer
param.default: The following setting controls the way that the Superfish menu appears on your site.

param.name: @spacer
param.default: The following setting controls the way that the Superfish menu appears on your site.

param.name: superfish
param.label: Enable scripts for Superfish Menu
param.description: This option enables the script for the superfish menu for the template. This script will only be output on the page if the left or right module positions have modules published to them.

param.name: sfEffect
param.label: Superfish Transition Type
param.description: Select the type of transition you would like applied to the superfish menu.

param.name: @spacer
param.default: Set this option to yes if you intend to use the Panel Menu. You also need to install the extended menu module for the panel menu to work. If you arent using the Panel Menu then its advised to set this to no in order to reduce the size of your page load.

param.name: panelMenu
param.label: Enable scripts for Panel Menu
param.description: This option enables the script for the panel menu for the template. This script will only be output on the page if the left or right module positions have modules published to them.

param.name: @spacer
param.default: The following settings change the text for the open and close button for the drop panel. In order for the button to appear you need to make sure that at least one module i spublished to the panel1, panel2, panel3 or panel4 positions. If you would like to disable the panel then make sure there are no modules published to these positions.

param.name: openPanel
param.label: Panel Open Text
param.description: Enter the text you would like displayed in the tab that triggers the sliding panel to open.

param.name: @spacer
param.default:
Width of the modules in the Panel (Panel1 to Panel4)
The following values need to add up to the total number of columns specified above. If any of the module positions in this row arent published then the value assigned to them does not count.

param.name: panelEqual
param.label: Panel Module widths
param.description: Select whether to equalise the modules published to a specific row. If set to use individual widths then the ratios below will have a bearing on the widths.
param.option: Use individual module position widths below
Equalise width according to number of modules published

param.name: panel1Width
param.label: Panel1 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: panel2Width
param.label: Panel2 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: panel3Width
param.label: Panel3 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: panel4Width
param.label: Panel4 Width
param.description: Set the width of this module position.

param.name: analytics
param.label: Analytics Code
param.description: Enter the javascript for your statistics software including the script tags.
